instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP1V35_CAM: What is PP1V35_CAM? PP1V35_CAM is a 1.35v power rail to power the webcam. .
definitions.PP1V8_CAM: What is PP1V8_CAM? PP1V8_CAM is a 1.8v power rail for powering the webcam.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No camera
threads.message:
Hi,

I've got an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B that won't recognize the iSight camera. Board was liquid damaged and had no backlight, no battery charge, wouldn't run on battery etc.

Fixed everything except this last issue. Checking <CHIP>U3900</CHIP>, PP0V675, <SIGNAL>PP1V8_CAM</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PP1V35_CAM</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PP1V2_CAM</SIGNAL> are all present during boot but as soon as it gets to the login screen, all voltages disappear.

Am I right in thinking the <CHIP>U3900</CHIP> is faulty? I've replaced the iSight camera cable and all sensors work.

Thanks!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No camera
threads.message: Probably an issue around <CHIP>U3900</CHIP>. Let me warn you this is a chip you don't really want to mess with :(

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No camera
threads.message: Wouldn't it be easier to just replace it or are there different factors at play here? Kind of frustrating that this is the last issue and everything else is working great now.:(

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No camera
threads.message: Pretty common failure on 3437...board works fine but no camera. We confirmed it was <CHIP>U3900</CHIP> on one of the dozen+ we've had with the issue. Not worth the time/effort/headache. That chip is a bitch to replace. Leave it as-is and sell it with camera not functioning. You'll be glad you did!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No camera
threads.message:
Thanks for the info. Can I ask what makes it a bitch to replace? I can see the chip is thicker than other ones but is it a problem with pulling pads? multilayered BGA chip like the iPhone compass IC?

Thanks again guys!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No camera
threads.message: The balls are super small. SMC is a larger chip, with larger balls, and has ~157 balls. <CHIP>U3900</CHIP> is smaller chip and has ~208 balls...very, very small and very easy for them to "run". It's also "CRITICAL", so you fuck it up and you now have a non-working board. Just not worth the risk/hassle/pain for a no-cam issue, really. People HAVE done it--I've done 1 of them, and I had to re-ball the chip twice before I even got it on the board. It just wasn't worth it. Took like 3-4 hours, and it was not fun. The time you spend repairing it will cost you more than the loss you'll incur with a no-cam, but working, board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No camera
threads.message:
Ah right, I got you now. Yeah that sounds like a pain in the ass. I kinda wrote off the cam after I got to the conclusion of <CHIP>U3900</CHIP> anyway but this just sort of cements the decision!

Only joined today and already this is a great forum!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No camera
threads.message: Pull it off a donor board and see why this is a bitch. 0.25mm balls, no stencil available. It can be done, but I usually don't bother.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No camera
threads.message:
Sorry guys but...

What if we buy them online, like on Aliexpress?...

Please don't me they are programmed?!... I have just removed one

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No camera
threads.message: They have no firmware so you can buy a new chip if you can find them.
